subject: Re: [junit] Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
msgSnippet: ... I imagine it s the same as the difference between a method marked @Test @Ignore and one with no annotations, except that I imagine the test runner doesn t
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:

> Mike,
>
> @Ignore predates me, but I think I've got my head around it.
>
> Let me turn the question around: what would be the difference between
> a method marked @BeforeClass @Ignore, and one with no annotations?

I imagine it's the same as the difference between a method marked @Test
@Ignore and one with no annotations, except that I imagine the test
runner doesn't notify you "I skipped this setup method because you asked
me to."
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
